Man is this data a nightmare to work with! Luckily the `eegkitdata` package in R has us covered! It has the training data storeed for us. ALl we have to grab is the training data. 

```{r}
library("reticulate") # use Python in R envior
library("data.table") # read in large files more quickly

use_python('/Users/jgeller1/opt/anaconda3/bin/python') # path to Python 

```

# This gets the training data
```{r}
library(eegkitdata)
library(knitr)
library(kableExtra)

train_eeg=data(eegdata) # train data

kable(head(train_eeg))
```
 This gets the test data 
```{r, eval=FALSE}

#Download the SMNI test data, unzip it, and combine
eegS1=geteegdata(indir=here::here("EEG_test", "SMNI_CMI_Test/"),
 cond="S1",filename="eegtestS1") # path to where the test data is stored

eegS2m=geteegdata(indir=here::here("EEG_test", "SMNI_CMI_Test/"),
 cond="S2m",filename="eegtestS2m")
 
eegS2n=geteegdata(indir=here::here("EEG_test", "SMNI_CMI_Test/"),
 cond="S2n",filename="eegtestS2n")
 
eegdata=rbind(eegS1,eegS2m,eegS2n)
```
